newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Autoliv rises over 3 pct on safety report.
newsitem.headline: Autoliv rises over 3 pct on safety report.

text.p: Shares in Swedish car safety equipment maker Autoliv jumped over three percent on Wednesday after a report by the U.S. National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) on airbags and child restraint systems.
At 1305 GMT the share traded at 240.50 crowns, up 7.50 in lively turnover on an otherwise softer Swedish sharemarket.
"This report was positive for Autoliv," said one Stockholm-based analyst.

The NTSB recommended the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration set up a timetable to implement so called "smart" airbags and require children up to age eight to use child safety seats and booster seats.
